parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake vacuum booster can cause extended stopping distances, increasing the risk of accidents, and potentially leading to loss of control or collision.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal must be pressed to the floor to stop the vehicle
the vehicle takes an additional 10-20 feet to stop
no response from the anti-lock braking system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the hydraulic brake system can cause a loss of brake pressure, leading to extended stopping distances, and potentially causing accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: Brake pressure shuts off during brake application
no response from the anti-lock braking system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the gears underneath the spider in the rear end can cause structural weakening, leading to potential loss of control, accidents, or wheel separation.
symptoms: Unusual noises or vibrations from the rear of the vehicle

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of ball joints can cause excessive tire wear, uneven tire wear, and difficulty in aligning the front end, leading to potential loss of control, accidents, or wheel separation.
symptoms: difficulty in aligning the front end
clunking or creaking noises from the suspension.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the automatic transmission dipstick can cause transmission fluid to leak and catch fire, posing a significant risk to vehicle occupants and other road users.
symptoms: Smoke coming from around the tail lights
transmission fluid being forced out of the vent tube
vehicle catching on fire while driving.
